summary: Email chain from October 2021 regarding an inquiry from the Russian Embassy about a Russian citizen (referred to as Jane Doe) who filed a lawsuit related to the Epstein case. The emails show U.S. officials acknowledging the inquiry but stating they are unfamiliar with the individual or lawsuit.

persons.name: Igor Sergeev
persons.role: Head of Legal Division, Embassy of the Russian Federation in the USA
persons.context: Sent the initial inquiry on behalf of the Russian Embassy seeking information about a Russian citizen involved in the Epstein case.

events.title: Russian Embassy inquiry about Epstein case
events.description: The Russian Embassy sends an inquiry to U.S. officials regarding a Russian citizen (Jane Doe) who filed a lawsuit related to the Epstein case, claiming to be a victim of sexual crimes.

locations: Embassy of the Russian Federation in the USA
keyFacts: The Russian Embassy inquired about a Russian citizen referred to as 'Jane Doe' who filed a lawsuit related to the Epstein case.
The inquiry was sent on October 18, 2021, by Igor Sergeev, Head of the Legal Division at the Russian Embassy.
U.S. officials responded that they were unfamiliar with the individual or lawsuit mentioned.
The document indicates international diplomatic interest in the Epstein case, specifically regarding potential Russian victims.
